sentences.sContent: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
sentences.sCn: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

sentences.sContent: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
sentences.sCn: 现任总统选举结束以后，政治暴力曾暂时平息。

trans.tranOther: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement
